messages.title: Only Labour will stand up for pensioners
messages.content: The Tories have launched an all-out attack on pensioners and have announced they would: Scrap the 'Triple Lock' on state pensions, Raise the State Pension Age, Means-test Winter Fuel Payments, Make even more people pay for their own social care.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour commits to preserving the 'Triple Lock' on state pensions.
Increase funding for the NHS to provide essential care.
Labour intends to eliminate tuition fees for students.
Focused investment in housing and infrastructure to bolster these areas.
Labour plans to back small and medium enterprises.
Labour aims to bring rail services back into public ownership.
Labour promises investment in education to make it inclusive, not just for the select few.
Labour will take action to address tax avoidance issues.

issues.education: Labour intends to eliminate tuition fees for students.
issues.health: Increase funding for the NHS to provide essential care.

housing.content: Focused investment in housing and infrastructure to bolster these areas.

contactInformation.address: Dr Chris Jones, St Mark's Church Hall, Hall Road, Norwich NR1 3HL

images.caption: Dr Chris Jones pictured with a backdrop of Norwich

leaflet.additionalNotes: Response to Tory policies and positions of Chloe Smith is used to contrast with Labour's pledges.
